TITLE: The Native American couple redefining relationship norms
SUMMARY: In the summer of 2019, as an overcast sky hung over Minnesota's Prairie Island Indian Community, photographer and filmmaker Tom√°s Karmelo Amaya took a portrait of a couple kissing while wearing colorful regalia.

TITLE: Al Qaeda promises 'war on all fronts' against America as Biden pulls out of Afghanistan
SUMMARY: This weekend marks the 10th anniversary since Osama Bin Laden, the mastermind of the September 11, 2001, attacks on the United States, was killed by US special-operations forces, Seal Team 6, inside his high-walled compound in the Pakistani military college city of Abbottabad.

TITLE: 20 years in Afghanistan: America's longest war
SUMMARY: Less than a month after the 9/11 attacks, American and allied forces began combat operations in Afghanistan, targeting al Qaeda and the Taliban regime that had been giving al Qaeda protection.

TITLE: Couple sues for housing discrimination after experiment yields shocking result
SUMMARY: A Black couple in California is suing an appraiser over housing discrimination after their home was valued significantly under what they expected it to be. Their suspicions were confirmed after their White friend showed the home to another appraiser and the value went up by nearly $500,000. CNN's Joe Johns has more.

TITLE: The fight to save Hawaii Sign Language from extinction
SUMMARY: Linda Yuen Lambrecht stands in front of a webcam, with the space from her head to her hips -- her signing space -- perfectly centered in the frame; a white plumeria fastened above her left ear. On screen, three women look back at her.

TITLE: Photos challenge negative stereotypes of Appalachia
SUMMARY: In the coal-mining towns of southeastern Ohio, nestled in the Appalachian mountains, photographer Rich-Joseph Facun has worked on a visual study of a region that has been stereotyped for decades. Appalachia has often been viewed one-dimensionally, saddled in associations related to poverty and opioid use, and deemed "Trump Country" during the 2016 election.
